wikitext.*:
'''White Lady''' is an epithet that referred to multiple women within the [[legendarium]].

During the [[First Age]], [[Aredhel]] ({{YT|1362}} - {{FA|400}}), an Elven princess and the sister of King [[Turgon]], was known as "the White Lady of the [[Noldor]]"<ref>{{S|Princes}}</ref><ref name="Maeglin">{{S|Maeglin}}</ref> and "the White Lady of [[Gondolin]]"<ref name="Maeglin" />.

During the [[Second Age]], [[Erendis]], a [[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] Queen and wife of [[Tar-Aldarion]], was known as the "White Lady of [[Emerië]]" and the "White Lady".<ref>{{UT|Wife}}</ref>

During the [[Third Age]], [[Éowyn]] (b. {{TA|2995}}), the niece of King [[Théoden]] and slayer of the [[Witch-king]], was called the "White Lady of [[Rohan]]" or the "White Lady" by [[Faramir]].<ref>{{RK|Steward}}, pp. 963-4</ref> The Lady of [[Lothlórien|Lórien]], [[Galadriel]] (b. {{YT|1362}}), the bearer of [[Nenya]], was also referred to as the "White Lady" by Faramir<ref>{{TT|Window}}, p. 679</ref> and by [[Eorl]]<ref>{{UT|Eorl}}</ref>.
